overview:
## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the application is multithreaded, otherwise [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Discussion

An application is considered multithreaded if a thread was ever detached from the main thread using either [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Thread/detachNewThreadSelector(_:toTarget:with:)] or [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Thread/start()]. If you detached a thread in your application using a non-Cocoa API, such as the POSIX or Multiprocessing Services APIs, this method could still return [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false]. The detached thread does not have to be currently running for the application to be considered multithreaded—this method only indicates whether a single thread has been spawned.

# isMultiThreaded()

**Type Method**

Returns whether the application is multithreaded.

## Declaration

```swift
class func isMultiThreaded() -> Bool
```

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the application is multithreaded, otherwise [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Discussion

An application is considered multithreaded if a thread was ever detached from the main thread using either [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Thread/detachNewThreadSelector(_:toTarget:with:)] or [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Thread/start()]. If you detached a thread in your application using a non-Cocoa API, such as the POSIX or Multiprocessing Services APIs, this method could still return [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false]. The detached thread does not have to be currently running for the application to be considered multithreaded—this method only indicates whether a single thread has been spawned.

## Querying the Environment

- **current**: Returns the thread object representing the current thread of execution.
- **callStackReturnAddresses**: Returns an array containing the call stack return addresses.
- **callStackSymbols**: Returns an array containing the call stack symbols.
